author: Thomas A. Edison
quoteText: There is no substitute for hard work.

author: Albert Camus
quoteText: The society based on production is only productive, not creative.

author: Bruce Lee
quoteText: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you’ll never get it done.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quoteText: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work..

author: Mark Twain
quoteText: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Oscar Wilde
quoteText: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Mahatma Gandi
quoteText: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: Mark Twain
quoteText: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).

author: Steve Martin
quoteText: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quoteText: You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quoteText: When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this: You haven't.

author: Albert Einstein
quoteText: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.

author: Nelson Mandela
quoteText: It always seems impossible until it's done.

author: George Eliot
quoteText: It is never too late to be what you might have been.

author: Francis Of Assisi
quoteText: Start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

author: Timothy Ferriss
quoteText: The way we measure productivity is flawed. People checking their BlackBerry over dinner is not the measure of productivity.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
quoteText: There is no way to happiness, happiness is the way.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quoteText: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.

author: Lao-Tzu
quoteText: Silence is a source of great strength.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quoteText: If you must tell me your opinions, tell me what you believe in. I have plenty of doubts of my own.

author: Confucius
quoteText: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: Winston Churchill
quoteText: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quoteText: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.

author: Seneca
quoteText: Ignorance is the cause of fear.

author: Alfred A. Montapert
quoteText: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.

author: Confucius
quoteText: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quoteText: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quoteText: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

author: H. G. Wells
quoteText: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quoteText: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

author: Confucius
quoteText: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.

author: Walt Disney
quoteText: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Oscar Wilde
quoteText: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.

author: Confucius
quoteText: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

author: Confucius
quoteText: Study the past if you would define the future.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quoteText: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.

author: Epictetus
quoteText: Only the educated are free.

author: Henry Ford
quoteText: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.

author: Buddha
quoteText: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back.

author: H. L. Mencken
quoteText: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.

author: Native American Saying
quoteText: If you chase two rabbits, you will lose them both.

author: Albert Einstein
quoteText: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

author: Kurdish Proverb
quoteText: Do not throw the arrow which will return against you.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quoteText: Be careful when you fight the monsters, lest you become one.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quoteText: Anger is never without Reason, but seldom with a good one.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quoteText: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.

author: Aristotle
quoteText: All paid jobs absorb and degrade the mind.

author: Aristotle
quoteText: A flatterer is a friend who is your inferior, or pretends to be so.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quoteText: Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security will deserve neither and lose both.

author: John Updike
quoteText: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.

author: Steve Wozniak
quoteText: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.
